response.overview: Rereading fundamental moments in the history of Brazil, the film studies the development of Brazilian economic concentration from its origins in the land "design" of discovery and colonization - to the irrepressible display of violence in the countryside today. The film is structured in three blocks subdivided into corners: - the first "discovers" the theme of the earth and its characters, focusing on the proper land problem; - the second analyzes land use by studying the agricultural economy; - and finally, the third presents the violence generated by the concentration studied in the first two. First documentary consisting of a large panel of landscape and Brazilian history, filmed throughout our territory and focusing on the land problem - with serious consequences for the current stage of Brazilian development from the discovery to the present day. Set up for greater ease of use, filling a serious gap with schools, unions and universities.
response.title: O Canto da Terra
